content.en: Fruit yield estimation: Researchers have been exploring the use of algorithms in machine vision systems to accurately estimate the mass, count, and size of citrus fruits during postharvest processing. These algorithms, such as logistic classification models and watershed algorithms, are able to analyze digital images and provide accurate measurements. Other studies have focused on using algorithms for fruit segmentation, shape analysis, and machine learning methods to detect and count fruits on plants, such as tomatoes, apples, and oranges. These advancements in machine vision technology have the potential to greatly improve the efficiency and accuracy of fruit yield estimation in agricultural settings.
content.da: Frugtudbytteestimering: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer i maskinvisionssystemer til nøjagtigt at estimere masse, antal og størrelse af citrusfrugter under efterbehandlingsprocessen. Disse algoritmer, såsom logistiske klassifikationsmodeller og watershed-algoritmer, kan analysere digitale billeder og give præcise målinger. Andre studier har fokuseret på at bruge algoritmer til frugtsegmentering, formanalyse og maskinlæringsmetoder til at opdage og tælle frugter på planter, såsom tomater, æbler og appelsiner. Disse fremskridt inden for maskinvisionsteknologi har potentiale til at forbedre effektiviteten og nøjagtigheden af frugtudbytteestimering markant i landbrugsmiljøer.
